title: 418th Anniversary of the First Landing and the Raising of the Cape Henry Cross
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, dated April 29, 2025, marking the 418th anniversary of the First Landing and the Raising of the Cape Henry Cross by the Jamestown settlers in Virginia. It recounts the journey of over 100 men who traveled from England in search of opportunity, commissioned by King James I. The proclamation emphasizes the significance of the Cape Henry Cross as a symbol of the settlers' dedication to God and their commitment to establishing a new land.

The document reflects on the challenges faced by the settlers, including drought, starvation, and disease, yet highlights their perseverance, which contributed to the foundation of the United States. It calls for a renewal of the nation's covenant to remain united under God and to seek His blessings. The proclamation officially designates April 29, 2025, as a day of celebration for this historical event, honoring the legacy of the settlers and their role in shaping American history.
